intro: Aloiampelos tenuior var. ernstii, commonly known as the narrowleaf star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically blooms in late winter to early spring, producing fragrant blooms that attract pollinators such as moths and bees. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or containers.
